result.execSummary:
The defendant Terri D Lathom was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine and costs to be paid at $50.00 per month commencing 11/01/2016 and each month thereafter or penalty of 9 days jail for non-payment.
Cash bail applied to costs. Balance to be paid along with fine.

**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

  Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terri D Lathom

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Previously Scanned and Destroyed
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Terri D Lathom in court with Attorney Clarice Rosa Perkins.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Barry Braatz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Perkins makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  FINE:   $326.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid out of cash bail posted ($50.00) and remainder due at rate of $50.00 per month, commencing 11/1/16, alternate 9 days jail if not paid) 

**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.**  

***Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.***
Hearing on October 4, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Procaccio to notify public defender's office so they can appoint new counsel.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for October 4, 2016 at 09:30 am.
